assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: Parkinson's disease is characterized by aggregated alpha-synuclein (Lewy bodies) and mitochondrial dysfunction. Mutant A53T alpha-synuclein leads to overactivation of autophagy, resulting in mitochondrial loss and neuronal death.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 2: Evaluate applicability of general classes of assay
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: Assays include primary cortical neurons overexpressing mutant protein, measurement of autophagy activation, and mitochondrial loss. Inhibitors block autophagy or mitochondrial targeting.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 3: Evaluate validity of specific instances of assays
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: Established models (primary neurons, autophagy inhibitors) are standard techniques in the field.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 4: Apply evidence to individual variant interpretation
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: No statistical data or OddsPath mentioned.
